description: Sunlit sandstone temples and storied forts — a sonic stroll through Warangal's timeless wonders

items.name: Warangal Fort – Explore The Ruins
items.section_title: Warangal Fort – Explore The Ruins
items.section_excerpt: In Warangal, historical places are endless and the famous Warangal Fort is a great example of that. Built in the 13th century, this place continues to be an epitome of exceptional architecture, even after getting attacked so many times. The ruins, especially in the middle zone is a good site for getting a glimpse of the city's glorious past, and we can vouch that a visit to this place would defini…
items.description: In Warangal, historical places are endless and the famous Warangal Fort is a great example of that. Built in the 13th century, this place continues to be an epitome of exceptional architecture, even after getting attacked so many times. The ruins, especially in the middle zone is a good site for getting a glimpse of the city's glorious past, and we can vouch that a visit to this place would definitely make you want to plan a trip to this city again.
query_hints: Warangal Fort – Explore The Ruins

items.name: Thousand Pillar Temple – Gape At The Intricate Designs
items.section_title: Thousand Pillar Temple – Gape At The Intricate Designs
items.section_excerpt: One of the most popular places to see in Warangal is the Thousand Pillar Temple, which is situated on the Hanamkonda hill. Also known as the Sri Rudreshwara Swamy Temple, this place mainly worships Lord Shiva and is famous across the world for its intricately carved pillars. Though, you will also come across other intriguing attractions like the rock cut elephants and a massive sculpture of Nandi.…
items.description: One of the most popular places to see in Warangal is the Thousand Pillar Temple, which is situated on the Hanamkonda hill. Also known as the Sri Rudreshwara Swamy Temple, this place mainly worships Lord Shiva and is famous across the world for its intricately carved pillars. Though, you will also come across other intriguing attractions like the rock cut elephants and a massive sculpture of Nandi. If you want to enjoy the best of Warangal tourism, make sure to visit this marvelous spot.
query_hints: Thousand Pillar Temple – Gape At The Intricate Designs
Thousand Pillar Temple – Gape At The Intricate Designs Warangal

items.name: Sri Veeranarayana Temple – Pay A Visit With Family
items.section_title: Sri Veeranarayana Temple – Pay A Visit With Family
items.section_excerpt: Temples are certainly one of the top places to visit in Warangal and the city's tourism & culture reflect it well. Being an ancient temple located in Kolanupaka in the district and undoubtedly a unique sight for tourists, this place definitely deserves a spot in your itinerary. For a more hassle-free and impeccable experience, make sure you visit during the morning hours when there is less crowd.
items.description: Temples are certainly one of the top places to visit in Warangal and the city's tourism & culture reflect it well. Being an ancient temple located in Kolanupaka in the district and undoubtedly a unique sight for tourists, this place definitely deserves a spot in your itinerary. For a more hassle-free and impeccable experience, make sure you visit during the morning hours when there is less crowd.

items.name: Kakatiya Rock Garden – Visit With Your Kids
items.section_title: Kakatiya Rock Garden – Visit With Your Kids
items.section_excerpt: Counted among the top places to visit in Warangal, Kakatiya Rock Garden is a place built for the comfort of the locals. The whole garden is manicured properly and is full of several flowers along with different kinds of plants & trees. On your visit to this garden, you will find several rock structures that are shaped in animals like lion, deer, antelopes, giraffe, sambar, and many more. It is one…
items.description: Counted among the top places to visit in Warangal, Kakatiya Rock Garden is a place built for the comfort of the locals. The whole garden is manicured properly and is full of several flowers along with different kinds of plants & trees. On your visit to this garden, you will find several rock structures that are shaped in animals like lion, deer, antelopes, giraffe, sambar, and many more. It is one of the amazing places to see in Warangal with your kids.
query_hints: Kakatiya Rock Garden – Visit With Your Kids
Kakatiya Rock Garden – Visit With Your Kids Warangal

items.name: Padmakshi Temple – Pray For Everyone’s Well-Being
items.section_title: Padmakshi Temple – Pray For Everyone’s Well-Being
items.section_excerpt: Another on the list of Warangal tourist places is the famous Padmakshi Temple which is dedicated to the Goddess Padmakshi. The temple can be dated back to the 12th century which is a reminiscence of mesmerizing architecture that has attracted several tourists from all around India. At the entrance of this temple, you will find the Annakonda Pillar which is made with black granite.
items.description: Another on the list of Warangal tourist places is the famous Padmakshi Temple which is dedicated to the Goddess Padmakshi. The temple can be dated back to the 12th century which is a reminiscence of mesmerizing architecture that has attracted several tourists from all around India. At the entrance of this temple, you will find the Annakonda Pillar which is made with black granite.

items.name: ISKCON – Take A Look At The Idols
items.section_title: ISKCON – Take A Look At The Idols
items.section_excerpt: Managed by the ISKCON authority, this temple is a must-visit place in Warangal that a religious person cannot afford to miss. The temple is said to propagate the teachings to the Bhagwad Geeta among the locals. This practice is done to inculcate the values that Krishna told about in the book to as many people as possible. Once you enter the premises of the temple, you will feel the calmness that w…
items.description: Managed by the ISKCON authority, this temple is a must-visit place in Warangal that a religious person cannot afford to miss. The temple is said to propagate the teachings to the Bhagwad Geeta among the locals. This practice is done to inculcate the values that Krishna told about in the book to as many people as possible. Once you enter the premises of the temple, you will feel the calmness that will still your mind. So, make sure that you pay a visit to this place as it is listed in the best Warangal sightseeing places.
query_hints: ISKCON – Take A Look At The Idols
ISKCON – Take A Look At The Idols Warangal

items.name: Vana Vigyan Kendra Mini Zoo – Meet The Animals
items.section_title: Vana Vigyan Kendra Mini Zoo – Meet The Animals
items.section_excerpt: Nestled in the heart of the district, this mini zoo was built in the year 1985 and is spread over an area of 50 acres. The whole area is home to several species of reptiles, animals, and birds that are living well in the green zone area. It has now been transformed into a National Zoological Park and now also has a separate area for butterflies which goes by the name Butterfly Park. Make sure that…
items.description: Nestled in the heart of the district, this mini zoo was built in the year 1985 and is spread over an area of 50 acres. The whole area is home to several species of reptiles, animals, and birds that are living well in the green zone area. It has now been transformed into a National Zoological Park and now also has a separate area for butterflies which goes by the name Butterfly Park. Make sure that you visit this place with your kids as it is one of the best places to visit in Warangal.
query_hints: Vana Vigyan Kendra Mini Zoo – Meet The Animals
Vana Vigyan Kendra Mini Zoo – Meet The Animals Warangal

items.name: Rayaparthy Shiva Temple – One Of The Oldest Temples
items.section_title: Rayaparthy Shiva Temple – One Of The Oldest Temples
items.section_excerpt: Built in the 18th century, Rayaparthy Shiva Temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva and is one of the top religious places to visit in Warangal. The temple is full of intricate carvings, inscriptions, and beautiful images. This, along with its scenic background, makes it one of the best Warangal sightseeing places. Make sure that you pay a visit to this place with your family and kids.
items.description: Built in the 18th century, Rayaparthy Shiva Temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva and is one of the top religious places to visit in Warangal. items.name: Swayambhu Temple – Witness The Natural Wonder
items.section_title: Swayambhu Temple – Witness The Natural Wonder
items.section_excerpt: This small temple is one of the top tourist places in Warangal which is visited by thousands of Shiva devotees. It is believed that the Linga in this temple emerged from the ground. This miracle has led to the popularity of this temple not only among the locals but also all around India. When you will visit this temple in Telangana, you will find a 4-feet high Nandi bull.
items.description: This small temple is one of the top tourist places in Warangal which is visited by thousands of Shiva devotees.
